info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 05 at 6:44PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Transylvania, northwestern Greenville and north central Pickens Counties through 715 PM EDT... At 644 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles south of Brevard, or near Rosman, moving northeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Brevard, Rosman, Looking Glass, Dupont State Forest, Table Rock State Park, Caesars Head State Park, Jones Gap State Park, Gorges State Park, Connestee and Rocky Bottom. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
